website_summaries.verdict: If you’re in the market for a surprisingly great motherboard featuring one-click overclocking and a premium cooling system that won’t break the bank, you’ve found it.
cons: Some of its screws are especially tightly fastened

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit well in Corsair 570x case (both atx)
customer_reviews.text: The mobo has trouble fitting in the Corsair 570x case. The top 3 standoff points will not align due to the built in IO shield. Be cautious picking this product if building with that case. M.2 screw is over tightened. Returning after the issues I had. Called ASUS for support, put on hold for almost half an hour then told they would call me back with a solution in 1-2 business days. It’s been almost a week.. Went with the Gigabyte version after. It has much better VRMs and I’m pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: m.s SSD screws over tight
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually write reviews but this drove me crazy. I had problem with the m.2 shield screws as well. They just don't come off. They are over tight. If you want to try your luck then go ahead, otherwise I would not recommend this mobo if you wish to use m.2 SSD. Amazon Customer Service was amazing and they let me return this mobo.
customer_reviews.author: ukhalid

customer_reviews.title: Some people need to use the right screwdriver .
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is made so the M2 screw that people complain about is secure. The reason that I see is that does not vibrate loose during use and short out the board or some other component. Also, check to see if the screwdriver is correct for the screw that you are trying to loosen, or tighten. Asus makes outstanding boards. I have used them for more than a decade. Don't try to overclock right off of the bat, let the thermal paste burn in and get your software set up FIRST!. Alway's ask someone for help if you don't know. Double check your build BEFORE YOU START!
customer_reviews.author: Spitfireuk42

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard with a few quirks
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great looking board, solid build and no error codes on first post. Cons: m.2 screws cannot be removed due to loctite VRM isn't up to par compared to similarly priced boards Other Thoughts: Almost all reviews, I see the m.2 screws being a PITA to remove. I was able to remove 1 set but was unlucky on the other. Will most likely RMA this because I can't install my other m.2 SAMSUNG 970 evo on it. Pretty upset because this board looks so good and will take another day to swap everything over to the new replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Reba

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Board, Easy Build
customer_reviews.text: Although pricey compared to other boards, it had all the features I wanted. I had no problems with the M.2 screws but I did purchase a screwdriver set that had a J1 bit in it as advised by another reviewer. Maybe some are being over tightened at the factory? Updated BIOS, then on reboot the system found the USB drive with windows. Only problem I had was while I thought I had connected the CPU fan to the correct header, I hadn't and the computer let me know. Rechecked the manual, found the right header, moved the connector, and the board has been working perfectly since. Very solid.
customer_reviews.author: SRS

customer_reviews.title: Good Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this MB for a little over a week now and I have no issues with it. There are lots of features in the bios I’m still trying to figure out. The MB has enough connections for all the fans I’m using (5 total). I didn’t have to use any of the fan connectors that came with the case I’m using. The M.2 screws came out with no issues... maybe I got a MB from a different lot than those with complaints about the M.2 screws.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: First motherboard I've ever used to OC my CPU. Was extremely simple navigating the BIOS. Install was a breeze. The RGB lighting looks very nice, not too over the top. Adds a nice touch through the glass door. My build, in case anyone else is needing ideas for the future: Case: NZXT H700 (Installing everything was a breeze, so much easy cable management in the back 10/10 recommend) CPU: Intel Core i7-8700k (OC'd to 4.8ghz, 35*C idle) Motherboard: Asus ROG Maximus XI Hero (WiFi AC) Graphics Card: Gigabyte GeForce GTX 1070 RAM: G.SKILL TridentZ RGB Series 32gb (Clocked @ 3000mhz) CPU Water Cooler: Corsair Hydro Series, H115i Pro RGB, 280mm. Dual 14mm Fans
customer_reviews.author: Kyle huskisson

customer_reviews.title: Had to return
customer_reviews.text: I had to return this motherboard because it clearly doesn't work with the Intel i9 processor, or at least not the one I received. I read online that it needs an update to run the i9, which of course doesn't do you any good if you can't get it to turn on in the first place. Another video showed someone using a blowdrier to get this motherboard to turn on. I don't understand why ASUS would make a product that doesn't work as advertised, whether it be running a 9th generation processor or not needing "tricks" just to start up for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: M.A. Kleen

customer_reviews.title: Top notch overclocker.
customer_reviews.text: this mother board rocks. The screw thing for the m2, i simply used the right size screw driver with good pressure. No problem. I did auto overclock. Ran cpu z. 5.0. 37% overclock on a 8700k processor. I used cosair vengeance ram, EVGA water cooling. Amazing, never got my custom water cooling rig running this fast. Pure awesomeness. Booting windows 10 From usb drive to install on m2 disk. No problem.
customer_reviews.author: Frenzy

customer_reviews.title: M.2 Screw issue fixed
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of reviews mentioning overtightened M.2 screws. I can say with confidence that in the board I received the screws were just fine. The reason this board gets only 4 stars is because of the 4 phase VRM when compared to other boards at this price point which all have 10+ phases. Outside of that it's great with some really nifty bios features including an AI overclock. the 4 phase VRM is even more puzzling when considering the rest of the board is really a dream for overclocking.
customer_reviews.author: Nikoras

customer_reviews.title: 2nd time was the charm.  Kudos to ASUS Support and Amazon returns dept.
customer_reviews.text: The original motherboard had a problem that required it be returned for a new one. ASUS Support was superb in diagnosing the problem and Amazon replaced the Maximus XI in a day. I admit I was skeptical, but the replacement Motherboard worked like a charm. I would have given a 5 star rating had the original one worked correctly. The fantastic support at ASUS is worthy of a 5 star review. I would order again. Fast, well documented, beautiful, and a perfect fit for my Corsair 750D case.
customer_reviews.author: Norm De Plume

customer_reviews.title: Paired to an i9 k
customer_reviews.text: If you pair this to an i9 99ook do "not" use the 5ghz or the gaming OC profiles, it will cause windows to either A) lock up on booting or B) lock up under even a medium-high load Watch some videos and OC the CPU the right way and your games will even be smoother, weather it ran at max FPS before or not, just do not use the built in profiles to OC.
customer_reviews.author: UnrealTairo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit! I/O shield too big.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t comment yet on performance but wanted to give a heads up to potential buyers that many, including me, are having serious issues with it fitting in cases. The integrated I/o shield is slightly too big and it makes aligning with case standoffs very hard. I had to take a grinder to my beautiful new case and trim some material off. This is 100% sloppy design work by ASUS. Maybe it will fit your case but be prepared for extreme frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: So bad.
customer_reviews.text: Barely fits, BIOS is a mess. Wouldn't boot to disk without changing settings. Audio is mediocre. Completely ruined my build and made it a pain to work with. (All of this on an alost 300$ motherboard). Unfortunately i most likely cannot return the motherboard since i have damaged it during the build. So disappointed in ASUS
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Board arrived DOE
customer_reviews.text: The board would not post, Went through the trouble shooting process which is quit lengthy and obtained a RMA. paid for packaging and post to return to asus. ASUS sent me another board and it to would not post no trouble code no beep , fans run lights lite pump pumps but no post. ASUS wants me to do another trouble report on the board they just sent me. So if you want to take the chance on there quality control and pay 20.00 shipping plus doing a bunch of repetitive paper work plus being without a computer for several months go ahead and by it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R Richer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: 1 week in and no problems to report regarding the hardware. Package showed up in a reasonable time. Packaging was solid. Everything showed up without a scratch. I did ample research before choosing the motherboard that was right for my setup: Mobo: Asus Rog Maximus Hero CPU: Intel i9-9900k GPU: Evga 2080 ftw3 Power Supply: Corsair hx750 Ram: Corsair 2x16 SSD: Evo plus 970 m.2 CPU water cooler: Corsair 80 Tower: Corsair d750 I highly suggest checking compatibility for all items. Just look online, easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard and Easy Install A+
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a computer/tech nerd by any length or measure and was able to successfully install and calibrate this motherboard for an Intel gaming rig I built. Reading the directions is/was a must in addition to watching youtube videos on how to install and calibrate. BIOS is really user friendly even for a novice. Despite almost dropping it during installation/re-installation multiple times, and my two year old son poking it with his toy dinosaur it functions without flaw or issue. It's very durable which is a plus. WIFI is decent however, the receiver is awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Labowski (Dude)

customer_reviews.title: ROG keeps Rockin'  -  Engineered and Built to go the Distance!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second build with ASUS ROG Maximus motherboards. Completely sold on the ROG line of MB's, it is a purchase that is a no brainer. They look as good as the engineering, design, technology and build that goes into them. The MB build was smooth and easy with no issues. There is a lot to say for quality, no surprises. I do lots of technical reviews for companies and the ASUS products that come across my bench always receive high marks - ASUS's dedication to their products shine through brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: VRS

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding and comprehensive MoBo.
customer_reviews.text: Well thought out MoBo, connects everything. Some difficulty connecting a few of the smaller headers correctly the first time, especially with fat fingers, but everything eventually goes together correctly. Instruction manual is great, nicely detailed, and the BIOS easy to work with, even for a newbie builder. An extra internal USB 3.0 header would be nice for the next revision. The only issue of note are the screws holding the M.2 NVMe SSD slot covers down—some are so tight they feel spot-welded. You need to use a small Phillips-head screwdriver (not the jewelers type, which is too small), held by a wrench for torque to get some of these open.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard dead on arrival! Very stressful but it happens
customer_reviews.text: Researched my new PC for over 3 months. I was so excited when all the parts arrived. Unfortunately after severally hours of building, it powered up but kept keeping "CC" errors. Switched ram, checked processor, and did all the troubleshooting to find the board was dead. I returned the board the next day after build at Kohl's for an immediate refund and went to Best Buy. I bought the exact same motherboard and all is good! =)
customer_reviews.author: Justin Schmetterer

customer_reviews.title: VALUE for the money is here!
customer_reviews.text: I know a lot of people complained about the IO fitment, but it fits in my case. I am using the Fractal Design S2 Black TG case. It was snug, but a beautiful fit in the end. The features on this MoBo are fantastic for the price, and the performance is there. I have it paired with the i9 9900K, and I feel like these were meant for each other. Yes, you could spend more for less return on investment. That is not for me to tell you to do, but know that this MoBo is just Great!
customer_reviews.author: Johnathon

customer_reviews.title: Becarful will not fit properly in Corsair crystal 570x And am sure so be aware
customer_reviews.text: good works fine but there is an issue if you want to install it in corsair 570x as it will not fit and needed to bend some so i can insert the motherboard and am sure because me and my friend bought the same case and the motherborad so be careful not sure whose fault corsair or Asus but be aware other than that motherboard is a beast.
customer_reviews.author: BADER

customer_reviews.title: Works good with overclock i9
customer_reviews.text: Running i9 9900k overclocked at 5ghz with out any issues for 3 months now. This is my main gaming pc so lots of usage without any issue. Running a asus cpu 240 cooler. Only complaint is I was sent a used board first(maybe seller issue not Asus) as the cpu pins were damaged and the plastic protection was missing upon opening box. Once new board arrived no issues. Ram spacing is tight if running 4 sticks so recommend only 2.
customer_reviews.author: JSO

customer_reviews.title: The sound card died on the first day
customer_reviews.text: ON the first day of setting up a system with this motherboard the sound card lasted for about 5 minutes - then it would no longer play any sound - no matter what. USB sound and bluetooth worked - though bluetooth would become choppy after about 5 minutes as well. Their customer support was terrible as well. I was chatting to their rep and they dropped me in the middle of the chat. Their response was just to run the windows Trouble shooter - and they did not offer an RMA. This is all very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Zerocleft

customer_reviews.title: Significantly better at CPU overclock than the Hero X.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Hero Xi board to replace a broken Hero X used for gaming. It performance at a higher CPU overclock at 4.9 as compared to the Hero X which maxed at 4.7GHZ. The board has the same mounting holes as the Hero X and all connectors are the similar except for the additional 4pin CPU power port. Easy to setup and performs optimally with a i7 intel Processor. Very happy with this board.
customer_reviews.author: Ed W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I have had this motherboard for over a year now. Rebuilt in a O11 Dynamic from a Thermaltake case (horrible thermals). 9900k with a Kraken 62 cooler, 48 gigs of RAM, and Gigabyte 280 Super. 30 idle CPU, 43 idle GPU. 50 under load CPU, 69 under load GPU. The case has 8 Cooler Master fans as well. CPU is clocked 4.8 all core just to keep thermals in check. Has been clocked to 5.1 all core but ran 45 idle and 80 under load. Motherboard had great capabilities if you know how to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Crimnsonfury

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This has been the worst motherboard I have ever owned. Started with audio issues with the onboard sound and now I constantly crash and it is a horrible board to over clock flashy piece of garbage will never buy an Asus board again
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Open On Arrival
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived in a box that wasn't shrink wrapped and without security tape to hold the box shut. The motherboard wasn't in an antistatic bag either. Not sure if anything like this is standard for the Asus boards but it was disconcerting. I also noticed the manual was used, you could tell someone had leafed through it. Everything appears to be present and I don't see any signs of screws being touched on the board. It just bothers me that I pay $300 US for a motherboard and the box is something someone else has touched after it left the manufacturer. Particularly since I'm planning to put a $500 CPU (i9-9900k) into it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Beck

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time with other Mobos I tried going with another company and was highly disappointed. If you want the best use ASUS ROG. Out of the box using a i9-9900k I got 5ghz on all cores with low temps.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas J Potts

customer_reviews.title: A perfect match with a 8700k or a 9900k
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard seems to work better with a I9 9900k, I originally had a 8700k in my machine however when the I9 9900k became available i picked it up and worked flawlessly , instant 5ghz and 3200 ddr 4.. Great motherboard overall and a lot of great features..
customer_reviews.author: Usernameunknown

customer_reviews.title: This is my second Asus MB and i Love it
customer_reviews.text: When I think of Quality, I first think of Asus. They put quality where it is needed most. Their boards are not buggy unless you get a defect. I love this board. It has all the latest features I need.
customer_reviews.author: Vespasion

customer_reviews.title: Amazing motherboard
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard looks amazing, the quality on it looks amazing and I have had no problems with it after having it for 12+ months. Asus Aura software works easily to change the RGB colors that illuminate from the motherboard. BIOS isn’t the best but it is nice and it works for me. Overall, I’d for sure recommend this motherboard to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Nathalie C.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: AI overclock is running an i7-9700k at 5.0ghz stable, the UEFI BIOS is really easy to understand. Everything was pretty easy to install, just make sure to follow the user's guide instructions while you are building your PC. I built my PC from scratch. Specs: Intel Core i7-9700K 3.6 GHz 8-Core Processor NZXT Kraken X62 CPU Cooler Asus ROG MAXIMUS XI HERO (WI-FI) G.Skill Trident Z RGB 32 GB 3200 C16 HP EX920 1 TB M.2-2280 Asus GeForce RTX 2070 SUPER 8 GB STRIX GAMING Advanced Video Card Corsair SPEC-DELTA RGB ATX Mid Tower Case Corsair RMx 750W 80+ Gold Certified Fully Modular ATX Power Supply
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Revelo

customer_reviews.title: Dead PCIe slot
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed on this motherboard. I has used this exact one on a previous computer build and worked amazing, this last one I got the PCIe sot number one did not work. The other two slots worked fine but it also had a few boot-up issues. Seems like it’s hit or miss with ASUS, they are usually pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: worked great
customer_reviews.text: the build was: i9900k, cooler master 612 v.2, asus 2070, 64gb of ram (corsair vengeance 3200mghz), 970 pro 1tb & 970 2tb. Used the AI overclocking feature, and it was a piece of cake. Got the 9900k overclocked to 5.1 ghz, and it's been stable ever since. A lot of people complain about being able to get the heatsync off cause the screws are too tight. I had no problem at all getting both off. Yes, there was a little blue lock tight on them both, but it really was no problem. Didn't slip with the screw driver even slightly. So far, this mobo is exactly what I needed, and has performed perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony B.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Good
customer_reviews.text: I have used many Crosshair motherboards in my builds for different computers. I have never had a bad experience with them until now. I received my board and plugged everything in and got everything hooked up. Upon boot, It does not seem that my GPU received power and I am getting an E5 code and cannot access bios. I am disappointed that I am having an issue with this motherboard as I have been a big fan of them in the past. Maybe this is a normal thing or maybe a quality control issue. I am not sure. Hope it gets fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: That m.2 screws
customer_reviews.text: I barely make it !! Guys make sure you have the right key for m.2 screws. It’s hard to remove because some smart guy on Asus put glue !! The best way to do is. Press a little bit in and turn the screwdriver . Overall its great for oc
customer_reviews.author: Carlos abreu

customer_reviews.title: Overclockers Paradise board.
customer_reviews.text: Love this board. The Overclocking AI works flawlessly. Not to mention all the exclusive software for it. Perfect match for my i7-8700k & RTX 2070 dual SSDs. Not to future purchasers when installing 2 sticks of ram to enable xmp profiles or ram doesnt perform very well. Also. If using 2 sticks. Use dimm slots a1 b1 or a2 b2. Never directly next to eachother unless flilling all slots..
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Allen

customer_reviews.title: No Signal
customer_reviews.text: I tried everything from flashing it to reseating the ram. But I could not get a signal to get into the bios. Had to return. Which is unfortunate this is the first time I have had issues with an Asus board across multiple builds.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: New ASUS Maximus Hero XI with mediocre quality inspection and defective usb headers
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive this premium motherboard. After unpacking, I didn't noticed that there were some marks around a couple of screws, but when installed on the motherboard and was securing it down on my pc I saw that there was something like glue or silicone around two screws. This is unacceptable from ASUS considering it is a premium gaming motherboard, the inspection should be more rigorous. Usb 2.0 headers on the motherboard do not work, I’ve tried CMOS reset, formatting the pc but can’t get those ports to connect to the AIO cooler As always Amazon rocks with delivery times and package protection.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Quintana

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard !!! No m.2 screw issue
customer_reviews.text: Giving it 4 out of 5 stars the board I receive looks good but the audio capacitors look misallgin slant a little just one of the capacitor but doesn't effect audio not sure if its supposed to look like that. Also m.2 screw was snug a little but came out very easy with the right tool Phillip's 00 Make sure it's that one and not 01 or 0 or u will strip screw also there's was no locite on them I guess Asus must've fixed this issue
customer_reviews.author: Deez Nutz

customer_reviews.title: This board started failing after one year
customer_reviews.text: This board started failing after one year. I haven't OC beyond the stock settings. Started with LEDs going dark, then MAXIMUS XI Hero wouldn't be seen with t he LED software. Flashed the BIOS, then I get BSODs frequently. Not reliable for work or Gaming. Sorry ASUS, never again.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Asus's best value board for 9900k
customer_reviews.text: Paired this with my 9900k and 32GB of 4133 RAM. Everything works and is intuitive, and was able to OC my 9900k to 5.1 GHz with no issues. Honestly a really fun board to build in too. Just remember to use the tiny nut/screw that comes with this board for your NVME installations.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: best board I ever bought look wise
customer_reviews.text: this board is so good looking best board I seen to date by far for looks but has some huge issues. When your wifi gets cut down to 20 mb nothing out there and no support knows how to fix it but i figured out tye fix and teached support the fix. Every board will have the issue too.
customer_reviews.author: Chad L.

customer_reviews.title: Major Stability Issues
customer_reviews.text: The first one I received did not work. Received a replacement and it did not work as well. Ordered a Gigabytez390 and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Crappy MOBO
customer_reviews.text: It only powered on ONCE for 2 minutes, and the motherboard decided to died. Tried CMOS reset, different PSU, press & hold reset....etc. Still the MOBO is dead. Very disappointed with Asus. Not the first time having such problem with them My faith with Asus product is far DONE !
customer_reviews.author: UberGeeks

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy ASUS
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made motherboard for the price. I had a loose capacitor that literally popped right off. ASUS support is a total joke and their "AI tuning" software is absolute garbage, bloat ware that will cause system performance and stability issues. I used ASUS for years but this company has obviously gone way downhill. As a 15+ year IT professional who has built multiple servers, workstations, and gaming rigs...Take my advice and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Watry

customer_reviews.title: Nice M/B with extras
customer_reviews.text: Overall very solid choice. Pros: Reliable. OC BIOS settings flexible and very easy to use. Good quality. Built-in sheild makes easy installation. Cons: Placement of some LEDs are covered by any graphics card in the recommended PCIe slot. LEDs not very bright.
customer_reviews.author: selective buyer

customer_reviews.title: Not aware that the Motherboard was used!
customer_reviews.text: The website did not specify, we were getting a used Motherboard. Once we opened the package we found the following: The SSD plate was missing the thermal “stick pad” that sits between the plate and the SSD The motherboard was missing a number of the factory protective plastic that typically comes on motherboards A spot on the motherboard was physically scratched Be aware you might get a used Motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: FH

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY Motherboard you need!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big fan of the ASUS Hero motherboards. They overclock my CPU and memory with ease and stability. I upgraded from the VIII to the XI (wi-fi) and I love it. I'm running an i9-9900k with AIO cooling and 64Gb of DDR4 3200 with both overclocked and it runs cool and stable. Excellent Motherboard!!!
customer_reviews.author: James Gray

customer_reviews.title: High quality MB for the price
customer_reviews.text: High quality MB overall with lots of options. Thermals (I use a liquid cooled CPU setup) are excellent and allows for considerable overclocking. I have both the hero and the formula versions with an i9K installed and have had a better experience with the hero MB thus far.
customer_reviews.author: Nick U.

customer_reviews.title: Great feature. Easy to install and use!
customer_reviews.text: Great board for upper end PCs. Warning first time firing it up the board needs to warm up before starting. Plug it in and let it warm up for 15 min. or so then push the start button. I thought i had a dud at first because it wouldn't fire. Just needed to warm up.
customer_reviews.author: MDLloyd

customer_reviews.title: All 3.1gen2 USBs are DEAD
customer_reviews.text: Asus isn't what it used to be. This crap motherboard has a lot of usb problems and i got one of the worse, EVERY gen2 usb port is useless including the type c and front header. Asus support is no help either.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: Great board! Upgraded from an ASUS Z370 Maximus X Hero. Bigger heatsinks for better cooling. Didn’t have problems removing the screws of the M.2 Coolers, but I didn’t use them stock ASUS coolers, I prefer the EKWB M.2 Coolers.
customer_reviews.author: Xzulu

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: I used this motherboard to build my first pc (with the help of a lot of youtube videos lol) and it is a little complex for first timers but it works great and after a little reading and video watching it wasnt that bad.
customer_reviews.author: Gabor Ambruzs

customer_reviews.title: A good mother board
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this board and was a bit worried about some of the reviews i had seen. In the end all of my concern was unfounded. While the screws for the m.2 were a bit tight and did have thread locker, a properly fitting screw driver easily removed the screws. Over all a great board
customer_reviews.author: Pyg

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I had to return two motherboards purchased from Amazon warehouse because of slow internet speeds. and aura was not working. I ended up buying a new one and I must say that It works great .awesome internet speeds ,and aura works. thanks Amazon for your great return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Newman

customer_reviews.title: had to replace it
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after a week. Asus is no longer a trusted brand.
customer_reviews.author: Said

customer_reviews.title: Slight hiccup, but ROG pulls through.
customer_reviews.text: First board was dead on arrival, which is why I give this 4 stars. My first and second PC builds had ROG motherboards and suffered the same ailment, but I'll still buy them because the are very well optimized for gaming builds! Second board arrived and install was clean. No issues and has been everything I have expected it to be and as every 3rd party review has rated it. Buying this board was the gateway to building into the next generation of components. (Enabled me to spend way too much money on high end gaming components, but well worth it.)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this motherboard for an upgraded PC I was building at work. I was so impressed that I ordered one for my home PC, and a third one for a build I'm doing for a friend. My only challenge with it was it only has 6 Sata ports; I have 7 drives in my machine. After adding an extension card, all is right in the world!
customer_reviews.author: Naf

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and fast!
customer_reviews.text: Boots win 10 in about 3 seconds. No problems at all, and all the Asus utilities work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel J. Haas

customer_reviews.title: not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: if the product worked with no problems it be a beast 2 dead ddr4 slots re seated the cpu all the sticks of ram are the same there brand new it was horible now i have to ship it out and order a whole new one not sure if it was cause it was used refurbished but this is a pain it works great with 2 sticks of ram its actually impressive the wifi is a beast
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great board
customer_reviews.text: This board is what I needed. All my RAM sticks, my 2070 super and my m2 all were easy to install. Did have to be careful with the screws to get to the m2 slot. The first board I got had a bent GPU pin but costumer service was good and replaced immediately.
customer_reviews.author: SomeGuy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, tons of tweaking for OC, all around great board
customer_reviews.text: I love the aesthetics of this board. It has a beautiful built-in I/O port shield that I wish motherboards had years ago! capable of very fast proc and mem combinations, I will hang on to this for a whie!
customer_reviews.author: Chris P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: This is easily the best mobo I have ever owned. When you take it out of the box you immediately recognize quality. It looks absolutely amazing and it has yet to fail me. It has plenty of power draw and you can easily overclock on it. I got my 9900k to 5ghz my first try no problem. The bios is very easy to navigate as well. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Willis

customer_reviews.title: The m.2 heatsink screw issue: as of 7/27/19
customer_reviews.text: After reading bad reviews about the screws from the m.2 heatsink, i felt a but nervous due to the fact i got a high end nvme m.2 but i had the right tools to remove them thanks to my ifixit kit. But i noticed there wasn't any blue coating (loctite) on the ends of the screws. Maybe the board manufacture saw the issue and resolved it? Not sure. But everything is looking and working great. Don't forget to "screw in with confidence"!
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a good product but I literally found a sticky, what seemed to be gum, on the motherboard. It was not only gross but annoying. Although that was bad, the box in which I received my mother board and gpu didn’t have any protection and by the looks of the box, they were thrown around A LOT. Super disappointed in Amazon and I usually don’t have any problems but it was a different story with my gpu and the motherboard. Other than that, it works “ok” but I don’t expect it to last long. Will update if anything changes on my part of amazons part.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Olivo

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit into Corsair 570X
customer_reviews.text: As another has mentioned, this motherboard does not fit with the Corsair 570X case due to the IO guard. The only solutions I’ve read have involved filing or bending the IO guard. Do not pair these products!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: works for overclocking 9900k + 2080 ti - great board
customer_reviews.text: this board does everything i need it to and i really like the bios set up. Very well done. they should include a usb thumb drive for the software instead of a CD, who uses cd's these days?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good board with good features
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered it the first time and put my pc together with this board my pc didn't boot. After some research, I found out that it's possible that the board is dead. So I applied for a board replacement and it worked, after 3 days of usage, I can safely say that this board is really good. The AI overclock feature is really useful and the wifi is also 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Viktor Bota

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mobo
customer_reviews.text: The construction, ascetics and display of this board is top-notch. The amount of settings in the BIOS is absurd and the GUI is very well laid out. The external BIOS and CMOS resets are a welcomed feature as well. I have had no issues with this board and drivers appear to be produced rather often.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I love asus motherboards. The uefi is designed really well and the build quality of this thing is excellent. So happy it has built in WiFi!
customer_reviews.author: Marv

customer_reviews.title: Lovvvve it!
customer_reviews.text: I like it a lot. Love all the inputs it has inside and outside inputs. Has error code diagnostic reader. Type c, USB 3.0 plug into inside motherboard. 6gb says, led inputs, many fan, and awesome Aurora lights! Hite!
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Trash!!! DONT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is complete garbage. It broke less than two months from purchase and ASUS customer service is completely incompetent. Im still in process of sending it back a second time for repairs. This after they claimed it was fixed after my first return. They didn’t even do a simple test before sending it back to me!! GARBAGE!!
customer_reviews.author: Slaphappy140

customer_reviews.title: Dead
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard was just a headache, I used Asus before and was very pleased with them so after decided to build me a new PC I thought an Asus would make a good choice but all I got was a dead motherboard and as I checked the blogs you can see that I was not the only one. Next time I would check the blogs first. Also, Asus support, have not heard from them at all. I wanted an RMA but ended by returning it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Good board BAD IO SHIELD
customer_reviews.text: Great unboxing experience great bios (like usual) great IO and general a good board. 1 MAJOR MAJOR sticking point. The IO shield. With it being pre-installed (and not at all removable without voiding any warranties) it conflicts with my case. As because of IO shield it does not fit in my case. After doing a quick search online it appears i am not alone. I had to dremel the back of my case to make it fit
customer_reviews.author: Xtzstud

customer_reviews.title: High quality board that lacks RGB brightness
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast board with more than enough features. BIOS software makes NVMe Raid and overclocking quick and easy. Has more than enough USB 3 ports on the back I/O as well as Thunderbolt Type C compatibility. Built in WiFi works great even without antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Very stable oc I recommend
customer_reviews.text: Great MO I don’t like the fact it has old connections in the back for old keyboards and old mice I feel they could have used that space to add more contemporary connections let’s just say additional USB ports or thunderbolt.
customer_reviews.author: Panos

customer_reviews.title: Best motherboard on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best motherboard I’ve ever owned just wish I knew how to fix the problem where every time my computer turns on or restarts it puts my keyboard in its own bios mode witch doesn’t allow me to access bios because the keys won’t work. The only way for me to access bios is through windows settings
customer_reviews.author: cole

customer_reviews.title: motherboard works great with Intel i8 cpu
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in sons new built and he loves this board. enough ports and works well with Intel I7-8700 cpu. Comes with all the cables and screws
customer_reviews.author: iverman

customer_reviews.title: Nice board, but not a good value at all
customer_reviews.text: I would expect a more feature rich board for the price. It's a nice motherboard, and it performs well, but let's see more I/O and less bling.
customer_reviews.author: A Buyer

customer_reviews.title: kinda mad at asus here
customer_reviews.text: the pre installed IO panel is extremely tight did not fit without alot of force and bending the back of my case a little to make room before i could get it to line up with the MOBO stand offs
customer_reviews.author: dakota

customer_reviews.title: Screws
customer_reviews.text: Everyone complaining about stripping the screws are probably useing to big of a screw driver. I used an ifixit small scree point and I was able to remove them no problem with out striping them or anything. Apart from that it's a beautifull board and works great with my i9 9900k
customer_reviews.author: Victor suarez

customer_reviews.title: Solid motherboard, good BIOS.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid for a high end board. The VRMs are nothing special, but still overclocked my i9-9900k to 5.0GHz on all 5 cores with no issues. I would have bought the other Maximus XI boards if they were stocked. Maybe next year I’ll hold off on not jumping as soon as the “latest and greatest” processors are released.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for studio recording. So far so good. It's a great motherboard. Has room for water cooled, air cooled.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Maximus is a G.O.A.T
customer_reviews.text: Really Great Motherboard! Great Quality. Can’t really say anything about it. Yes! The board is expensive. But hey. You get what you pay for. I am Huge ASUS Maximus anyways. They’ve never failed me. This is my 4th build.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: 20mb internet cap....
customer_reviews.text: I now have to take my entire rig apart to send back the 10 day old motherboard because im capping out at 20 mbps internet speed.... I went through trouble shooting everything else and it is 100% the motherboard (Im hard wired into the modem) im definitely not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: al

customer_reviews.title: Amazing motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is able to overclock my i9 9900K to 5.3 GHz at 1.3 v and it's very stable. I also love all the features that it's got and I'm happy that I went with this motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Jett Angeles

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: The m.2 screw stripped out and know the drive is unusable. I can’t get the screw out. I managed to get the other screw out and realized it had locktite on it. So frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing...
customer_reviews.text: I love this motherboard personally. The backplate made it a little difficult to line up and set in place but when I got it everything was beautiful and working. The wifi built in was working right off the bat. This motherboard is a must have. I'm running an i7 8700 with it and performance is great. I'm also using the rog gtx strix 1070 graphics.
customer_reviews.author: bryan

customer_reviews.title: Overclocking beast!
customer_reviews.text: Overclocked my 9900ks to 5.2 per core super easy with this bad boy. Temps ate stable and all is running fine!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and start overclocking. The automatic software update and AI suite is better on this generation of motherboards. Overclocking at 41% on first try.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: M.2 screw morons
customer_reviews.text: Use the right screw driver and you won't have an issue with the m.2 it's a #1 Phillips. If you strip it your pretty much a moron.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Hero
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few different Hero boards of different chipsets and they've all been fantastic performers and reliable. This board is no exception, fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: JasonV

customer_reviews.title: m2 screw issue again
customer_reviews.text: I did my research, this board looked good. Saw the comments regarding the screws being to tight to take off the heat sink if you're installing an M2 drive. Figured it probably didn't affect everyone, so decided to go for it. Wrong! Just returned it. If you're not planning on using M2 SSD's, then it's probably a great board. But if you are, it's trash.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Peachey

customer_reviews.title: Loving the board!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, had for almost half a year now. So many option and a cpu tweekers paradise. Easy to install and add all the new tech and gadgets to
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Got my i9-9900k installed with this MB but only boots when bios updated with the latest firmware manually. Be aware!
customer_reviews.author: David Hou

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard best i've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard very well built speed silver keys take some getting use to but once you do they're great asus finished them with a nice texture on top to give a slight enjoyable grainy feeling, great leds, & keyboard feels heavy and light at the same time great build quality &&&&& NO PING!!!!!! like many of the mechanical keyboards I've owned
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: No complaints about the VRMs
customer_reviews.text: When MSI, EVGA, Gigabyte, etc. boards fail I replace them with an Asus because they don't break.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great Motherboard!!
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard!! It was a breeze to install and works great with the Intel i9 9900k CPU & Corsair RGB Pro for RAM. Paired with more RGB features, it seems to be super compatible with other systems.
customer_reviews.author: FairladyZ

product_meta.title: ASUS ROG Maximus XI Hero (Wi-Fi) Z390 Gaming Motherboard LGA1151 (Intel 8th 9th Gen) ATX DDR4 DP HDMI M.2 USB 3.1 Gen2 802.11AC Wi-Fi
product_meta.description: Style:MotherboardLoad up with more cores for more performance with the ROG Maximus XI Hero Wi Fi, ready for 9th generation Intel Core processors. The revamped ASUS 5 Way Optimization overclocks intelligently based on smart prediction and thermal telemetry while FanXpert 4 delivers dynamic system cooling. Aura Sync with addressable headers features full RGB customization. Bluetooth Bluetooth 5.0. Operating System - Windows 10 64-bit. Form Factor- ATX Form Factor size - 12 inch x 9.6 inch.
feature_bullets: Designed for 9th 8th Generation Intel Core processors maximize connectivity, speed with Dual M.2, USB 3.1 Gen 2, on board 802.11AC Wi Fi and ASUS optimum II for better DRAM overclocking stability
Revamped 5 way Optimization over clocks Intelligently based on smart prediction and thermal telemetry while FanXpert 4 delivers dynamic system cooling
Aura Sync RGB lighting with addressable headers features a nearly endless spectrum of colors with the ability to synchronize effects across an ever expanding ecosystem of AURA Sync enabled products
Pre mounted I/O shield ensures streamlined installation and represents ROG's attention to detail and quality

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars899 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
